discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Answer: A

Prisma Cloud can integrate with the following secrets managers:
-AWS Secrets Manager
-AWS Systems Manager Parameters Store
-Azure Key Vault
-CyberArk Enterprise Password Vault
-HashiCorp Vault (versions 0.9.x and older, and versions 0.10 and later)

https://docs.prismacloud.io/en/compute-edition/22-12/admin-guide/secrets/integrate-with-secrets-stores

questions.question_text: Prisma Cloud cannot integrate which of the following secrets managers?

choices.A: The console cannot natively run in an ECS cluster. A onebox deployment should be used.
choices.B: Download and extract the release tarball Ensure that each node has its own storage for Console data Create the Console task definition Deploy the task definition
choices.C: Download and extract release tarball Download task from AWS Create the Console task definition Deploy the task definition
choices.D: Download and extract the release tarball Create an EFS file system and mount to each node in the cluster Create the Console task definition Deploy the task definition

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
The correct answer is:

D. Download and extract the release tarball, create an EFS (Elastic File System) file system and mount it to each node in the cluster, create the Console task definition, and deploy the task definition.

questions.question_text: Given an existing ECS Cluster, which option shows the steps required to install the Console in Amazon ECS?
Which options show the steps required to upgrade Console when using projects?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
When you have one or more tenant or scale Projects, upgrade all Supervisors before upgrading the Central Console.

https://docs.paloaltonetworks.com/prisma/prisma-cloud/20-09/prisma-cloud-compute-edition-admin/upgrade/upgrade_process
When you have one or more tenant or scale Projects, upgrade all Supervisors before upgrading the Central Console

choices.D: Upgrade Central Console Upgrade all Supervisor Consoles
choices.A: Upgrade all Supervisor Consoles Upgrade Central Console
choices.C: Upgrade Defender Upgrade Central Console Upgrade Supervisor Consoles
choices.B: Upgrade Central Console Upgrade Central Console Defenders

questions.question_text:
A customer has Prisma Cloud Enterprise and host Defenders deployed.
What are two options that allow an administrator to upgrade Defenders? (Choose two.)

choices.C: click the update button in the web-interface.
choices.A: with auto-upgrade, the host Defender will auto-upgrade.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AC
If Defender auto-upgrade is enabled — Console will upgrade deployed Defenders for you. If Console fails to upgrade one or more Defenders, it displays a banner at the top of the UI. If you’ve created an alert for Defender health events, Console emits a message on the alert channel for any Defender it fails to upgrade. Manually upgrade any Defenders that Console could not auto-upgrade.

If Defender auto-upgrade is disabled — Manually upgrade all deployed Defenders.

questions.question_text: Which intensity setting for anomaly alerts is used for the measurement of 100 events over 30 days?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
For unusual user activity:
Medium: The behavioral models are based on observing at least 100 events over 30 days.
